context: The cycle time was set at 28s and the sample time 10,000ms. The GC column utilized was a 5m length methyl silicone (DB-1), 0.25μm film thickness and 500μm (i.d.). The sample flow rate was set at 25mlmin−1. For the determination of acetone using GC-IMS, the tedlar bag was connected to a teflon tube, which was adjusted in front of the inlet of the instrument. GC-IMS peaks were identified using the retention time and drift time of vapor standards in hexane. The vapor calibration standards were prepared as described in the literature. 2.3.3
